block.p: It seemed more coronation than inauguration -- a palace, a choir, a red carpet, a huge gold emblem. But after Vladimir V. Putin was sworn in as Russia's second president, he pledged to build a democratic and capitalist nation. Capitalist, yes: his new prime minister, Mikhail Kasyanov, is an economic liberal who has deftly renegotiated Russia's Western debt.

It seemed more coronation than inauguration -- a palace, a choir, a red carpet, a huge gold emblem. But after Vladimir V. Putin was sworn in as Russia's second president, he pledged to build a democratic and capitalist nation. Capitalist, yes: his new prime minister, Mikhail Kasyanov, is an economic liberal who has deftly renegotiated Russia's Western debt.
But democratic? At week's end, a police raid and search of the media conglomerate that is the Kremlin's major critic, Media-Most, left some wondering about Mr. Putin's political ideals.
